Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2008 08:13PM manatee wrote: Otter, I agonized over that decision a month ago.  My surgeon didn't even mention mastectomy, but sent me to radiation oncologist before scheduling surgery.  I looked all over this site and others between those two appointments.  On the way back home from seeing the radiation oncologist, I just decided radiation wasn't for me.  I called the surgeon, and had a unilateral mastectomy without reconstruction.  I have no regrets.  Recovery was very short (one night in the hospital, one week off work).  I had DCIS, Stage 0, 0/9 nodes, ER+/PR+.  I am seriously considering mastectomy on my right breast.  I didn't think I could handle both at the same time--now I think maybe I could have.  It is definitely not an easy choice, and I know exactly what you are feeling.  I'll be praying that whatever decision you make, you feel at peace after surgery like I did.
Posts.Title: Feeling pressured to have lumpectomy instead of mastectomy otter irishdreama
